title: Synchronization issue and stuck at block 3731518
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`

geth n$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.6.0-stable
Git Commit: facc47cb5cec97b22c815a0a6118816a98f39876
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.8.1
Operating System: darwin
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/go

OS & Version: OSX  10.12.3 (16D32)
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
Geth should sync the blockchain but fails at same block everytime. I have "chaindata" backup from 15th May and I restore it from there but synchronization is failing. Using two different SSDs, one for geth binaries and another of "chaindata"

#### Actual behaviour
INFO [05-19|16:45:29] Imported new chain segment               blocks=51  txs=1673 mgas=79.209  elapsed=8.442s    mgasps=9.382  number=3731216 hash=f58057…191159
INFO [05-19|16:45:38] Imported new chain segment               blocks=71  txs=1620 mgas=71.049  elapsed=8.526s    mgasps=8.333  number=3731287 hash=3b0693…34a767
INFO [05-19|16:45:46] Imported new chain segment               blocks=64  txs=1615 mgas=76.730  elapsed=8.771s    mgasps=8.748  number=3731351 hash=c597f8…6b622c
INFO [05-19|16:45:54] Imported new chain segment               blocks=57  txs=1378 mgas=57.473  elapsed=8.023s    mgasps=7.163  number=3731408 hash=db727b…b621b5
INFO [05-19|16:46:02] Imported new chain segment               blocks=45  txs=1444 mgas=54.160  elapsed=8.126s    mgasps=6.665  number=3731453 hash=36525a…12d8ac
INFO [05-19|16:46:11] Imported new chain segment               blocks=61  txs=1354 mgas=57.817  elapsed=8.042s    mgasps=7.189  number=3731514 hash=c584c5…c4dccc
panic: node 5c49fc4c53075bf00470eb692a44f94d664abd8afcfbf7f93a86f004695fd5fd: invalid number of list elements: 16

goroutine 676 [running]:

	/Users/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/trie.go:458 +0x424
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*Trie).tryGet(0xc5c3d074a0, 0x5072a20, 0xc574781860, 0xc57477e0f0, 0x41, 0x41, 0x3, 0x200, 0x43f0000, 0x50707e0, ...)
	/Users/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/trie.go:182 +0x137

	/Users/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/trie.go:174 +0x87b
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*Trie).tryGet(0xc5c3d074a0, 0x5072a20, 0xc574781620, 0xc57477e0f0, 0x41, 0x41, 0x2, 0x240, 0x43f0000, 0x50707e0, ...)
	/Users/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/trie.go:186 +0x276
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*Trie).tryGet(0xc5c3d074a0, 0x50707e0, 0xc4e43a4f00, 0xc57477e0f0, 0x41, 0x41, 0x1, 0xc57477e0f1, 0x40, 0x40, ...)

github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*Trie).tryGet(0xc5c3d074a0, 0x5072a20, 0xc574780480, 0xc57477e0f0, 0x41, 0x41, 0x1, 0x63bd3a0d5f05b4d8, 0xddc92decd5d4f696, 0x88cd35b6dca22be5, ...)

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I've "chaindata" folder back from May 15, 2017 and I restored it. After copying it ran "geth --cache=4096". It syncs it but eventually getting error. See above.
